header_summary:
Recent discussions in the Bitcoin community have centered on innovative security enhancements for wallet management and the broader digital transaction ecosystem. Oren introduced a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) focused on Timelock-Recovery plans after discussions at BTC++ Taiwan with Ava Chow, aiming to address the complexities of storing recovery seeds and handling inheritance securely. This proposal includes the development of a Timelock Recovery plugin for Electrum, streamlining the transaction signing process for users, and proposes the adoption of a standardized JSON format for transaction details to ensure compatibility across different wallets ([Electrum](https://electrum.org), [RITREK](https://ritrek.com)).

Parallelly, the discourse has shifted towards employing commit-based approaches to bolster security against MITM-style attacks, favoring a gradual transition to full quantum-safe (PQ) signature schemes. This includes the development of the Quantum-Resilient Modular Verification Layer (QRMVL) framework, which offers a soft-fork-compatible pathway towards PQ validation, integrating stateful and stateless hash-based signatures and proposing a tiered security level system to accommodate varying needs. The community is invited to provide feedback on the practical implementation aspects of this framework, with resources and a draft whitepaper available for review at [karinCrypto's GitHub](https://github.com/karinCrypto/bitcoin-quantum-scaling/blob/main/whitepaper/QRMVL%20v1%20A%20First%20Edition%20Framework%20for%20Quantum-Resilient%20Verification%20in%20Bitcoin_.pdf) and [karinCrypto's GitHub - QRMVL](https://github.com/karinCrypto/bitcoin-quantum-scaling).

recent_posts.title: BIP idea: Timelock-Recovery storage format
recent_posts.summary:
- Oren proposes a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal for Timelock-Recovery plans at BTC++ Taiwan.
- The BIP focuses on pre-signing transactions for secure long-term Bitcoin storage and inheritance.
- A Timelock Recovery plugin for Electrum standardizes this process, fostering wider adoption.

recent_posts.title: QRMVL: Modular Verification Layer for Post-Quantum Hash-Based Signatures
recent_posts.summary:
- Commit-based security approaches mitigate MITM attacks and prepare for quantum-safe transitions.
- The QRMVL framework introduces a gradual path to quantum-resistant Bitcoin, incorporating hybrid signatures.
- Feedback on practicality and technical adjustments for QRMVL is sought, with resources available online.

active_posts.title: Unbreaking testnet4
active_posts.summary:
- Testnet4 continued Testnet3's difficulty reset issues, conflicting with its mainnet simulation goal.
- The difficulty reset rule, meant to aid developers, has clashed with the PoW network's traits.
- A proposal suggests removing this rule by a hard fork on January 1, 2026, for smooth transition.

active_posts.title: Hash-Based Signatures for Bitcoin's Post-Quantum Future
active_posts.summary:
- Hash-based cryptographic solutions are increasingly explored for Bitcoin's quantum resistance.
- Optimizations can reduce hash-based signature sizes without sacrificing security.
- The Bitcoin community is encouraged to discuss the integration of post-quantum solutions.

active_posts.title: Re: The Cat, BIP draft discussion.
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses implementing "The Cat" for spam mitigation in Bitcoin's network.
- Critics question spam mitigation's effectiveness versus Bitcoin's decentralization ethos.
- Despite debates, there's cautious support for "The Cat" to enhance network efficiency and sustainability.

active_posts.title: P2share: how to turn any network (or testnet!) into a bitcoin miner
active_posts.summary:
- The p2share network introduces a unique bitcoin mining rewards distribution based on shares.
- It employs a random selection to give the entire bitcoin reward to one shareholder, enhancing fairness.
- This model aims to decentralize and innovate the ecosystem, potentially impacting future blockchain developments.

today_in_history_posts.title: Proof-of-Stake Bitcoin Sidechains
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Matt Bell has developed a Bitcoin sidechain design using Tendermint BFT protocol.
- His design is similar to Blockstream's Liquid sidechain, focusing on a "strong federation" mechanism.
- Matt is seeking feedback to refine his design, sharing a detailed document for review.

today_in_history_posts.title: Lightning and the semantic web
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Melvin plans to integrate the Lightning Network with Solid through ontology development.
- He seeks existing work on this integration or partners for collaboration.
- Solid aims for data control; Lightning Network enhances Bitcoin transactions.

today_in_history_posts.title: [BUG]: spammers get Bitcoin blockspace at discounted price. Let's fix it
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A simple Bitcoin transaction can cost more than a complex one due to pricing disparities.
- The sender proposes uniform pricing for blockspace to prevent misallocation and centralization.
- Implementing uniform pricing in Segwit transactions could equalize costs and incentives.
